channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024040404
item.description:
Report E-2024040404

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-15
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: WHILE DRIVER PERFORMED A PRE-TRIP INSPECTION AT TERMINAL. DRIVER NOTICED A VERY SLIGHT LEAK FROM UNDER THE TRAILER. INVESTIGATION SHOWED THE EXTERNAL PACKING NUT WAS LOOSE CAUSING THE LEAK. THE PACKING NUT WAS PROPERLY SECURED BY SITE MECHANIC. SPILL WAS CLEANED UP BY PLANT PERSONNELL.

item.title: Report X-2024040608
item.description:
Report X-2024040608

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED ON THE FLOOR AT THE 100 BELT ON THE CART SIDE, WITH THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX OPEN AND CONTENTS (GRANULES) LEAKING OUT. ERIC BEST REPORTED THE HAZMAT IMMEDIATELY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY PLACED IT INTO A LINED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF THE BODY OF THE BUCKET CRACKED, APPROX. 2.5 TO 3 INCHES LONG. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT BUCKET UPSIDE DOWN TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE

item.title: Report X-2024040506
item.description:
Report X-2024040506

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Ops Manager alerted me to the damage. He indicated that a package handler had dropped the package causing the package to leak. I placed package in a hazmat bag and in a hazmat tote and brought it to our hazmat cage. DescribePack: Leaked at the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bagged and placed in a hazmat tote and brought to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040526
item.description:
Report X-2024040526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED FROM TRAILER WITH VISIBLE LEAKAGE ON UPPER CORNER. IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TUB AND PLACED INTO HAZMAT CAGE. DescribePack: UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHERE LEAKAGE IS OCCURING FROM- CAPS ARE TIGHT, NO VISIBLE CRACKS OR PUNCTURES IN THE SIDEWALL. LIQUID IN THE PLASTIC BAG CONTAINING THE BOTTLE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE IMMEDIATELY PLACED INTO THE HAZMAT CAGE AND ORIENTATION ARROWS WERE RESPECTED IN THE TUB.

item.title: Report X-2024040462
item.description:
Report X-2024040462

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: FORT MILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler loading van notified QA that there was a leaking hazmat in their work area. Package was assessed and determined that product leaked internally due to a loose cap/broken seal. DescribePack: Package failure occurred at the seal on the lid of container. Seal was broken and cap became loose which caused product to leak internally. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from belt line and place in a lined hazmat drum.

item.title: Report X-2024040353
item.description:
Report X-2024040353

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: GREENVILLE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED IN TRAILER TAIL ALREADY LEAKING, PACKAGE PLACED INTO LINED HAZMAT TUB IMMEDIATELY DescribePack: CRACK WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AT THE ENTIRE BASE OF THE CYLINDER IN DIAMETER AND APPROXIMATELY 2 INCHES UP THE SIDE WALL DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY CONTAINED INSIDE OF A LINED HAZMAT BIN
